bboxes.raw_text:
Les Femmes dart held its
first dance at Convention Center,
Safari Hotel, Sat-, Dec. %. -


Officers include Mesdames
William C. Smith, Jr., president;
Aubrey C. Aldridge, vice presi-
dent; Alton Thomas, treasurer:
Homer Roberts, secretary; Low
ell C. Wormley, asst. secretary;
John S. Jones, parliamentarian;
Circe, Mcclellan, historian and
Gerald Swain, reporter.


Mrs. Robert Harper was dance
chairman and she was assisted
by Mrs. A. D. Hart.


Other members are Mesdames
William Bennett, William Corbin,
Hayzel B. Daniels, Lwrence
Fields, Frank HUFF, William Lit
Teton, Leonard E. Wilburn, Fred
Williams and D. w. Williams.

ART CLUB


HOLDS FIRST
HOLIDAY DANCE

SPECIAL NOTTCEl DIT. Mary
Thompson, chairman of the Pur-
pie and White formal committee,
reports her purse disappeared
from the lodge kitchen. She would
like to have her important, per-
sonal papers and Identification
cards returned. Please mail or
return purse and papers to the
w. H. Patterson Elks Lodge, 1907
So. 9TH Ave. No questions asked.


DIT. Essie Richie attended fun
eral services for her cousin,
Lille Mae Richie in Los Angeles,
Dec. 26.


Mildred Gerton, 1912 w. Apa-
che, is recuperating at Memorial
Hospital, ] West R, %. Mrs.
Cordie Cotton who was injured
at the same time is also in the
same room.


Mrs. Gerton' S daughter, Mar
go, 10, Is in the children s wing
at Memorial.


They were injured in an auto
train wreck early Christmas
morning at 18th Ave and Maricopa
Freeway.


Calendar Jan. 8 = Regular
Daughter meeting; Jan g. PDRC
installation wear full regalia;
Jan. IA = Joint installation, all
members should be present; Jan.
"a PISA convention committee
meet, 4 pm.


Officers elected by w. H. Pat
terson Lodge VAT or 1864 are
Isiah Ward, exalted ruler; Wal
lace Croomes, est. leading
knight; Charles Williams, secre-
tary: S. L. Carr, treasurer; Tony
Shoals, esquire; David McClam-
my, tiler: Homer Kennedy, inner
guard; Arthur Blackshear, Virgil
Berry, Eldridge Gonoway, James
McElroy and Japalee Harrison,
trustees.

ELKS CORNER
CHARLESETTA
MCC MT-R EPORTER

WASHINGTON About ESQ mil
lion dollars year Of public as
sistance money goes to support
$50 thousand families whose faith
ers have deserted them.


Acting Director John Hurley
of the Bureau of Family Services
gave that figure Wednesday in
making public a report of a
national meeting of law enforce
ment and public welfare officials.


"The ideal solution, of course,
is to locate the DESERVING father,
attempt to get him to join his
family or. failing that, obtain his
contribution to the support his
children" Mr.. Hurley said.


But he said many deserving
fathers slip through the net.

WASHINGTON = Mrs. Jessie
Jones, Is, a small Negro mother,
is petitioning the Federal Court
of Appeals to ouash the order
of Judge j. Sicily Wright. which
directed hospital authorities to
give her a TRANSMISSION on Sept.
II.


Mrs. Jones and her husband
are Jehovah s Witnesses. When
he rushed her toGeorgetown Uni
versity Hospital last September,
doctors said she would die from
a bleeding ulcer unless she re-
ceived blood.


They refused to authorize the
TRANSMISSION and the hospital
sought a court order. The first
request was rejected, but Judge
Wright granted the request. Mrs.
Jones received the TRANSMISSION
and recovered.


Now she wants to make sure
that she will never be forced to
have a blood TRANSMISSION again.
A devout woman, Mrs. Jones
said, sit is better to keep God 8
law than to compromise ones
beliefs"


She and her husband say they
are fighting for their religious
rights.

The largest prison is the Khar-
kov Jail in the U.S.S.R., which
once housed 10000 prisoners.
The smallest is on the Isle of
Sark in the Channel Islands, which
has a capacity of two.

Discovered South of the border This richly thick decously
spicy brought back the border recipe
everyone enjoy it. It's excellent
with whipped your favorite whipped topping
vanilla ice


pie deectabe fairly hearty
after and salad meal different accompaniment
of hot coffee exciting substitute for
birthday cake.


Spicy Coconut Pie
1-1/3 cups (about) faxed 1 teaspoon ground


cinnamon
1 unbaked 9-inch pie shell 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
tablespoons butter 1 teaspoon vanilla
granulated 1 extract
eggs, beaten Whipped cream, prepared
1 cup dark corn syrup dessert topping,
1/8 teaspoon salt vanilla ice cream .


Flaked coconut (optional)
Sprinkle unbaked she'll Cream together
butter and Add remaining ngred
WE'LL then pour coconut pie she'll Bake in
minutes Serve with "crescents of
whipped prinked with additional faxed coconu Makes
to 8 servings.

Baptist Church. 245 Chapman Rd the setting for
wedding ceremony Carol Jackson and War
rem Livingston.


Reid, pastor, ofcated the marriage
which performed Sat-. Dec %.


From left are Misses Gipson Dolores Gordon,
bridesmaids Mrs Fay Pete honor Mrs Lv
ngston MIR. Livingston and Patricia Jackson Glen Jackson
ring bearer.


The bride is University
is majoring in elementary education


The is graduate of the University of Arizona and is


member of the Dallas Cowboys professional ooball
Second hotor and Mrs Moody Jackson 2736 Roeser Rd
parents of the bride, pose the reception.


The newlywed in front the cake, while the groom
parents Mr. and Mrs L. B. Livingston Mesa watch from the
right

Chisom-Wise wedding party
Misses Mary Charlene DARRELL Ethel Daniels
nell Wise, apo and Mrs. Richard Gibson, Alex
WISE Larry Hemphill and Dewayne Harrel.


The bride ASU majoring secondary
Her parents Mr.. and Mrs. Ruben Wise, Mesa.


The is stationed Williams Air Force Base His
are Mr.. and Mrs. Richard Gibson, Sr., of Manu. Fla.


NEW SALEM CHURCH BEING BUILT
New Salem Baptist Church is pastor, wishes that
under 1850 services WILL be nelo as soon as
E. Grant St. Rev. S. G. Marshall possible

pastor. wishes to announce that
services will be held as soon as
possible.
